snippet: Detroit began a crucial stage in the city’s bankruptcy case that allows retirees, employees and bondholders to cast votes on a painful debt-shedding plan.
abstract: Detroit drops tens of thousands of ballots in the mail, initiating crucial stage in the city's bankruptcy case that allows retirees, employees and bondholders to cast votes on painful debt-shredding plan; vote amounts to gamble for many of the city's 32,000 pension recipients, where they either support proposed cuts or risk losing more.
lead_paragraph: Detroit began a crucial stage in the city’s bankruptcy case that allows retirees, employees and bondholders to cast votes on a painful debt-shedding plan.

headline.main: Detroit Pension Ballot Poses Tough Choices
headline.print_headline: Detroit Pension Ballot Poses Tough Choices
